Mr. Karunakar Reddy said Satish’s body was found on a railway track just days after questioning by the SIT and fresh notices to appear before it. Mr. Karunakar Reddy said that the government is using the Parakamani case solely to settle political scores and the coalition government has converted the sacred TTD into a political battlefield. He further alleged that the CID was pressurising Satish Kumar to disclose his name and link him to the Parakamani case.

Dismissing the allegations, TTD Trust board member G. Bhanuprakash Reddy urged the government and the State police to conduct a thorough investigation to unravel the mystery behind Satish Kumar’s death. Suspecting foul play, the BJP leader alleged that it could be a case of murder as Satish Kumar was going to reveal the names of several influential persons who were behind the settlement in the Parakamani scam.

title: Rabi water release schedule for Tungabhadra canals announced
content:
Water release schedule for various canals under the Tungabhadra project were finalised for the 2025-26 rabi season at the 125th meeting of the Tungabhadra Irrigation Consultative Committee at the Vidhana Soudha in Bengaluru on Friday.

The meeting, chaired by Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar, who also holds the Water Resources portfolio, reviewed water availability in the Tungabhadra Reservoir and discussed supply constraints arising from the ongoing installation of crest gates, in the event of the water level reaching 1,613 ft.

In view of these works, the Irrigation Consultative Committee noted that it will not be possible to provide water for an extended irrigation season and therefore, it resolved to release water primarily for standing crops and essential uses, including drinking needs during summer.

Accordingly, it was decided that water will be released into the Tungabhadra Left Bank Main Canal starting December 1, 2025 till January 10, 2026 at a rate of 3,000 cusecs for standing crops.

The Vijayanagar Left Bank Canal will receive water from January 1 to May 10, 2026, at 150 cusecs, covering distributary canals 1 to 11, subject to availability.

For the Tungabhadra Right Bank High Level Canal, water will be supplied from December 1, 2025 to January 10, 2026 at a rate of 1,300 cusecs, while the Tungabhadra Right Bank Low Level Canal will receive water during the same period at 750 cusecs for only standing crops.

The Raya Basavanna canal will get an average supply of 250 cusecs from January 1 to May 31, 2026 or until water remains available, whichever is earlier.

In addition, it was resolved to supply 150 cusecs to the river-supplemented areas, including industrial units dependent on the system.

The committee also approved release of water into the Left Bank High Level Canal from December 1 at 25 cusecs until the reservoir level falls to 1,585 ft.

Speaking after the meeting, Irrigation Consultative Committee Chairman and Minister Shivaraj S. Tangadagi said that the schedule balanced the limited water availability with the need to protect standing crops in the command areas.

He said that the decision reflects the consensus reached after detailed deliberations with people’s representatives, irrigation officials and district administrations.

Minister N.S. Boseraju, MPs, MLAs, MLCs, Regional Commissioners, Deputy Commissioners and senior officers of the Irrigation and Agriculture Departments participated in the meeting.

title: Fifth national migration conference in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The International Institute of Migration and Development (IIMAD), Thiruvananthapuram, chaired by S. Irudaya Rajan, in collaboration with the International Council of World Affairs (ICWA), New Delhi, is organising the 5th National Migration Conference on November 17 and November 18 in Thiruvananthapuram. For further details and registration contact, 9567099390.

title: Dravidian movement freed women from shackles of enslavement: Deputy CM Udhayanidhi Stalin
content:
While women were enslaved, treated as subservient to men and denied the right to education, it was the Dravidian Movement, through its 100 years of struggle and sacrifice, which ensured that women were treated equal and received education, said Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin.

Mr. Udhayanidhi Stalin on the occasion of Children’s Day, at Alagappa Model School in Karaikudi on Friday, distributed free bicycles to Class XI students.

Speaking there, he added, “Education can eradicate poverty in a family. But it does not just provide wealth and money, but also gives confidence and power. That is why the Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin is implementing several schemes and policies in both school and higher education sectors compared to anywhere else in India.”

Claiming the highest percentage of girl students being educated in the State as a success of the Dravidian model government, he stated that of the total of 5.35 lakh bicycles that were distributed to students across Tamil Nadu, more than 57,000 were girl children.

“The number far exceeds the number of boys. This is because of the successful enrolment of girl students in schools,” he noted.

He advised the students to develop their power of thinking. Adding that students were capable of thinking on par with adults, he surprisingly said, “In fact, many times, children are the teachers to their own parents.”

Emphasising the ‘rationalism’ espoused and followed by great leaders like Periyar, C.N. Annadurai and M. Karunanidhi, Mr. Udhayanidhi appealed to the students to constantly seek answers to their questions.

“Only through constant questioning – Why, What and How – can we get the answers we need. This is how Tamil Nadu has become the best State in education in the country,” he elaborated.

The students of the State should develop perseverance and develop their thinking skills to be able to elevate Tamil Nadu to a level where the students could compete with global nations.

On the various government schemes which were supporting the students at multiple levels, he said, “The Breakfast Scheme is being provided to 22 lakh children in schools, under the Thamizh Pudhalvan and Pudhumai Penn schemes, eight lakh college students receive ₹1,000 per month and soon, the free laptop scheme will also be implemented in colleges.”

He commented that the ‘reels’ shared on social media platforms were not real life, and about three quarters of the content shown there were false and misleading.

“The reels should not give a false perception about life. Only the real education you possess, and follow will stand by you,” he added.

Additionally, Mr. Udhayanidhi Stalin requested the teachers not to borrow the physical education classes for other subjects. “Physical education is as important to a student as other subjects,” he added.

About 12,500 free bicycles were distributed to 12,500 students in the district.

Minister for Co-operation K.S. Periyakaruppan, School Education Minister Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi, Minister for Backward Classes Welfare Siva V. Meyyanathan, District Collector K. Porkodi, among others were present during the event.

title: NHAI orders urgent safety audit of Aroor-Thuravoor elevated NH corridor project
content:
The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has appointed RITES Limited to conduct an urgent and comprehensive safety audit of the ongoing construction of the six-lane elevated corridor on NH 66 between Aroor and Thuravoor.

According to an official statement on Friday, the NHAI has ordered the safety check to ensure that the construction work meets the highest standards of safety and quality. The scope of work for RITES Limited is designed to thoroughly review the project’s execution.

The team will ensure that the work undertaken on the site strictly follows the approved construction plans and methods. A key focus will be on verifying that all work zone safety norms, and the rules for protecting workers and the public near the construction site are being followed as per the guidelines stipulated by the Indian Road Congress (IRC).

Based on the outcome of the Aroor-Thuravoor audit, NHAI will adopt steps to expand the safety inspection work to other stretches of the NH-66 corridor to ensure uniform safety and quality across all major highway projects in the region.

Officials from the NHAI, including members of an expert committee, on Friday visited the site of the girder collapse at the Aroor-Thuravoor elevated highway where a pickup driver was killed to ascertain the cause of the accident. The team examined the spot where a girder had fallen as well as the area where it had been installed. Representatives of the contractor responsible for the construction on the particular stretch of the national highway were also present.

Collector seeks report

The District Collector has sought a detailed report regarding the accident, which apparently brought to fore lapses by various agencies in ensuring public and motorists’ safety.

Alappuzha MP K.C. Venugopal wrote to the Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways, Nitin Gadkari, seeking strict action against those responsible for the accident and to compensate the family of Rajesh. He also urged the Union Minister to institute a probe to assess the ongoing work, identify systemic lapses and recommend safety directives to prevent further accidents.

Tharoor’s petition

In a separate petition, Shashi Tharoor, MP, called for an independent safety audit of all ongoing National Highway construction zones in Kerala, and to suspend all high-risk construction activities until certified safety clearances are obtained.

He also suggested mandating the public disclosure of a revised completion timeline, along with quarterly progress and safety reports for all national highway projects in the State.

title: Dakshina Kannada District Cooperative Milk Producers’ Societies’ Union Ltd. to launch Seeds Delight and Guava Chilli Lassi
content:
The Dakshina Kannada District Cooperative Milk Producers’ Societies’ Union Ltd. (DKMUL) will launch two new products, Nandini Seeds Delight and Guava Chilli Lassi, on November 16 in Mangaluru.

Union President K. Raviraj Hegde told reporters here on Friday, November 14, that the launch will be held during the 72nd Cooperative Week celebrations at Mangala Stadium.

Nandini Seeds Delight was manufactured using quality seeds of watermelon, sweet gourd, flax, and almond along with sugar, Nandini milk, ghee and khova. The Guava Chilli Lassi was produced using guava pulp, salt, sugar, chilli powder, lemon juice, and Nandini curd.

These two products will be distributed free of cost at all Nandini outlets till stocks last on November 17, Mr. Hegde added.

title: Three-day bird festival begins in Wayanad
content:
Hundreds flocked to the first-ever experiential bird festival, ‘Haekki Benakku’, which began at the Hume Centre for Ecology and Wildlife Biology at Puliyarmala near Kalpetta in Wayanad on Friday (November 14, 2025).

Eminent ornithologists, bird lovers, bird watchers, nature enthusiasts, and green activists gathered at the venue. Activities for students included weaving nests, identifying bird species, and interactive sessions on bird conservation.

T. Siddique, MLA, who inaugurated the festival, said birds played an important role in sustaining fragile ecosystems across the world. “The notion that human beings are at the top of everything in nature has resulted in widespread destruction,” he said, adding that birds are the real saviours of nature. “Until the Mundakkai–Chooralmala landslide struck, society had not given much attention to issues concerning nature, but the tragedy changed everything,” he said, stressing the need for environmental awareness.

Principal Conservator of Forests Pramod G. Krishnan was the guest of honour. Kerala State Biodiversity Board Chairman N. Anilkumar delivered the keynote address. Hume Centre advisory board chairman G. Balagopal presided.

The festival features a ‘Birder’s Stall’ that showcases details of various unique bird species, methods for identifying them, their life patterns, the threats they face, and a wealth of bird-related information. A photography exhibition on the birders of Wayanad is also part of the event.

Renowned ornithologists presented sessions on ‘Global Ornithological History’ (C. Sasikumar, ornithologist and chairman of Humes); ‘A Brief History of Indian Ornithology’ (Dr. Pramod P., Senior Principal Scientist at the Salim Ali Centre for Ornithology and Natural History); ‘Bird Monitoring via Citizen Science in India’ (Dr. Roshnath Ramesh, State Coordinator of the Heronry Surveys in Kerala); and ‘Bird Monitoring via Citizen Science in India’ (Ashwin Viswanathan, Research Associate at the Nature Conservation Foundation).

Cultural programmes, including Bavul music by Shanthi Priya and theatre performances, are part of the festival. The event will conclude on Sunday.

title: KRRS condemns burning of tractors; holds govt.’s negligent attitude responsible for the incident
content:
The Karnataka Rajya Raitha Sangha (KRRS) has condemned the recent act of burning of tractors in front of a sugar factory at Sameerwadi in Bagalkot district, and also held the government’s negligent attitude towards the farmers’ agitation responsible for the incident.

“Whoever may have committed it, the act of setting fire to the sugarcane-laden tractors in front of the sugar factory in Sameerwadi is condemnable,” KRRS leader Badagalapura Nagendra said in a statement here.

He said the farmers had been holding a peaceful demonstration demanding payment of pending sugarcane dues as well as a fair price for the last 15 days. The farmers in Mudhol, Haveri, and Bidar had continued their protest opposing the price fixed by the government on November 8.

He accused the government of displaying negligence by failing to call the protesting farmers of these districts and the management of the sugar factories for a discussion to resolve the issue. “It is this negligent attitude of the government that has led to such an incident,” Mr. Nagendra said in the statement.

The KRRS has requested the farmers and protestors to continue their agitation in a peaceful manner while appealing to them to remain alert and give no room for any mischief of unlawful acts.

Judicial probe

Contending that the farmers’ leaders, who were in the forefront of the agitation in Mudhol, were ‘sensible, well-informed, and committed to non-violent methods of struggle’, the KRRS leader said, according to information available, it was unlikely that the protestors were themselves responsible for the incident relating to setting fire to the sugarcane-laden truck.

“Prima facie, it appears that there is a conspiracy and involvement of vetted interests behind it. Reports also suggest that the act may have been carried out by individuals associated with the sugar factory’s management”, he alleged while urging the government to order a judicial probe to identify the miscreants behind the condemnable incident.

Mr Badagalapura also urged the government to immediately invite the protestors of Bagalkote, Haveri, and Bidar, along with the sugar factory owners of the regions, to hold discussions and resolve the issue.

He also said the Union government was trying to evade responsibility by claiming that the sugarcane issue raised by the farmers was not related to it.

Union Minister for Food and Public Distribution Pralhad Joshi, who is an elected representative, must intervene immediately and help find a solution to the imbroglio. Former Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai, who is also an MP from the region, too, cannot afford to remain silent, Mr. Nagendra said.

title: TVK functionary, associate held for stealing bike
content:
The Melapalayam police have arrested two persons, including a Tamilaga Vetri Kazhagam (TVK) functionary, for allegedly stealing a bike at Vaeinthaankulam new bus-stand.

Police said Muthukrishnan, 26, of V.M. Chathram here, who had gone to fill-up the chest in the ATM machine at Vaeinthaankulam new bus-stand on last Wednesday, had parked his bike near the first platform. When he returned after 45 minutes, he found that his two-wheeler had been stolen.

As Mr. Muthukrishnan alerted the policemen in the bus-stand, the police started checking the CCTV cameras fitted near the scene of crime. Even as the police were trying to identify the culprits, two unidentified persons were bringing back Mr. Muthukrishnan’s bike to the spot where they took the two-wheeler. On seeing the police, the duo parked the bike at a distance and tried to flee. However, they were nabbed immediately.

During inquiry, they, who were identified as bike mechanic Muthukumar, 30, of Sattankulam and his associate Thangaraja, 37, of Nanguneri, told the police that as there was no fuel in the bike, they had to bring it back to the spot where they stole the vehicle in a bid to hide the theft.

During inquiry, police found that Muthukumar, a Tamilaga Vetri Kazhagam functionary, and Thangaraja had stolen five bikes which were recovered.

Further investigations are on.

title: Inter-state digital arrest scam busted in Kadapa, 12 arrested
content:
The Kadapa police on Friday (November 14, 2025) busted an inter-state digital arrest scam and arrested twelve persons and recovered ₹12.58 lakh cash. Additionally, seventeen mobile phones, thirteen bank passbooks, six cheque books, 52 ATM cards and 16 SIM cards and six Aadhaar cards were seized.

The police said that the accused no. 1 in the case R. Narasimha alias Naveen (35) of Shivamogga (Karnataka) is a business management graduate, who used to collect bank account details through social media groups (Telegram), get mule accounts opened and transfer the deposited amounts to crypto currency or cash. Piyush Teli (25) of Rajasthan, the A2, is a graduate having prior work experience in Dubai, has wide knowledge of funds transfer for large amounts.

The other accused were identified as Gaggeri Ravichandra (22), Bhoopathi Prashanth (20), Annapureddy Pothu Raju (23), Chennapureddy Pedda Brahma Reddy (28), Udumula Venkata Reddy (21), Chinnapureddy Brahma Reddy (21), Uppari Nagendra (22), Thiruveedhi Vishnuvardhan (21), Venteddu Sai Likhith Kumar (20) and Palabindela Akhil (22), the last four are engineering students from Andhra Pradesh and Telangana.

The complainant Veera Reddy, a retired government official, got a video call seven months ago from anonymous persons posing as CBI officials, accusing him of complicity in a crime “currently under investigation by the CBI”. They also demanded money to be paid into a government account, to be returned after he was proven innocent.

Immaculate backdrop

The victim was hoodwinked by the immaculate backdrop resembling the interiors of a posh police station and the culprits appearing in police uniforms. Even a court scene was recreated, where a judge warned him of arrest within 24 hours. Panicked by the illusory scenes on the video, the senior citizen transferred ₹30 lakh to various accounts, which vanished in no time. The victim approached the local police station after the accused stopped responding to his calls.

Superintendent of Police Shelke Nachiket Vishwanath, who produced the accused at a media conference here on Friday, called upon the public not to panic if they received calls on ‘digital arrest’, as there was no such procedure in law.

“Cyber crime fraudsters find it easy to apply the digital arrest modus operandi on senior citizens, who are an easy prey, considering their age, lack of understanding of the evolving technological jargon and the presence of unguarded funds in savings bank accounts,” he said.

Mr. Vishwanath appreciated the Additional Superintendent (Admin) K. Prakash Babu, Deputy Superintendent (Pulivendula) B. Murali, Circle Inspectors Narasimhulu (Vempalle) and A. Madhu Malleswara Reddy (Cyber Crime) for busting the sensational crime and arresting the culprits. A hunt has been launched to arrest the others named as accused in the case.

title: Minister Mano Thangaraj launches free bicycle distribution to 14,025 students in Kanniyakumari
content:
Minister of Dairy Development T. Mano Thangaraj formally launched the distribution of free bicycles to students in the district on Friday.

As the district has received 14,025 vehicles for students of 140 government and aided schools, the Minister inaugurated the distribution of free bicycles at St. Mary Goretty Higher Secondary School in Manalikarai.

Speaking at the event, Mr. Mano Thangaraj highlighted the impact of climate change, especially the rising pollution caused by uncontrollable vehicle emissions. He noted that increase use of bicycles could significantly reduce pollution levels and exhorted the students to use bicycles as it is not only eco-friendly but also beneficial for both physical and mental health.

Emphasising that the State government has allocated ₹47,000 crore for the school education department, he urged the students to focus on their studies to achieve greater heights.

“The government has been implementing various initiatives for the children including free uniforms, breakfast scheme and ‘Pudhumai Penn and Tamil Pudhalvan’ schemes for students who complete school education, only to ensure that the students continue their education without any constraints,” he added.

Kanniyakumari Collector R. Alagumeena, Chief Educational Officer R. Prince Arockiyaraj, District Backward Classes Welfare Department Officer Senthur Pandian and other officials were present.

title: Karnataka High Court directs State government to give status report on implementation of Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act
content:
The High Court of Karnataka on Friday directed the State government to file a status report on the implementation of various important provisions of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016, on a PIL petition, which has complained about Karnataka’s “persistent and unjustifiable delay” in implementing the mandate of this law meant for welfare of persons with disabilities (PwD).

A Division Bench comprising Chief Justice Vibhu Bakhru and Justice C.M. Poonacha issued the direction on the petition filed by Y. Karthik, 27, who suffers from visual impairment and cerebral palsy, and his brother, Y. Kaushik, 27, along with their father, Y.M. Satish, who is a MLC.

Despite the passage of nearly a decade since the new enactment, the State government has failed to operationalise several of the core provisions and key statutory obligations like ensuring reservation in employment, identifying posts, implementing social security schemes, establishing a dedicated PwD fund, and providing institutional support at the district and taluk levels remained unfulfilled, it has been complained.

Referring to a report of the Comptroller and Auditor General of India on performance audit in implementation of the Act, and other documents, it has been contended in the petition that delay in implementation of the provisions of the law has deprived PwDs access to welfare schemes, employment, and social protections guaranteed through this legislation.

While seeking directions for effective implementation of various provisions of the Act, the petitioners have sought specific directions for constituting State Fund for PwD, issue Unique Disability Identity to all eligible persons, and cancel UDID issued to ineligible persons, to ensure that teachers educating PwDs are registered under the Rehabilitation Council of India Act, 1992, establish special training centre to promote vocational training for PwDs and provide sufficient infrastructure for PwDs in all schools, increase pension for PwDs, among other pleas.

Meanwhile, it has been made it clear in the petition that Mr. Satish, who has set up various facilities for the benefit of PwDs besides making donations to private and non-government organisations working for the welfare of PwDs, is not seeking any benefit from the schemes of the government for his son as he is financially capable of looking after his needs.

Further hearing on the petition has adjourned till February 4, 2026.

title: Naidu, Piyush Goyal lay foundation for Drone City and Space City in Rayalaseema
content:
Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu and Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday virtually laid the foundation stone for the proposed Drone City and Space City projects in the Rayalaseema region, on the sidelines of the 30th CII Partnership Summit in Visakhapatnam.

Drone City will be developed on 300 acres at Orvakal in Kurnool district, with facilities for drone design, manufacturing, services, and R&D at global standards. It will feature advanced manufacturing parks, testing and certification centres, and training facilities for 25,000 drone pilots. The project is expected to create over 40,000 direct and indirect jobs. The State will offer incentives including a 20% capital subsidy and 100% SGST refund.

Twin Space Cities will come up in Sri Sathya Sai and Tirupati districts — the first of their kind in the country — to boost private-sector participation in the Indian space ecosystem. They will focus on satellite prototyping, space-tech startup incubation, component manufacturing, and launch logistics support. Space City is projected to attract ₹25,000 crore in investments and generate over 35,000 jobs in the next decade. The State has earmarked ₹100 crore under the Space Tech Fund as part of A.P. Space Policy 4.0.

Mr. Goyal said there is significant demand for drones and that Andhra Pradesh had seized the opportunity by conceptualising Drone City. Drawing a parallel with Mr. Naidu’s early push for Information Technology, he said the Chief Minister was now steering the State towards emerging sectors such as drones, space, AI, and quantum technologies. He credited Mr. Naidu with establishing the country’s first Drone City and Space City and said the Chief Minister and Prime Minister Narendra Modi were working together for national and State development.

He appreciated Mr. Naidu’s role in the growth of India’s IT sector during the era of undivided Andhra Pradesh. Referring to drones’ contribution in Operation Sindoor, he highlighted the need for India to become self-reliant in producing high-quality drones, adding that the Kurnool facility would be pivotal in achieving that goal. He also welcomed the plan for a Space City near Sriharikota, India’s rocket-launching hub.

Mr. Goyal endorsed the State’s move to create an escrow account to ensure 100% SGST refunds and 20% capital investment reimbursements, describing it as a transparent mechanism free from political or bureaucratic interference.

He concluded that the Prime Minister’s vision of a drone in every farmer’s field and a smartphone for every Indian would be realised under Swarna Andhra 2047 and Viksit Bharat 2047.

title: Kavitha says ‘karma hits back’ as BRS loses Jubilee Hills
content:
Suspended BRS MLC and Telangana Jagruthi president K. Kavitha took a sharp dig at her former party’s leadership following its defeat in the Jubilee Hills Assembly byelection, remarking that ‘karma hits back’.

Her comment, posted on ‘X’ soon after the results were declared, triggered a fresh round of speculation about deepening rifts and also Ms. Kavitha’s serious differences with her family’s party, which is now literally being headed by her brother K.T. Rama Rao in the silence of BRS chief K. Chandrashekhar Rao.

The cryptic post is being widely interpreted as an indirect attack on her brother and former Minister Mr. K.T. Rama Rao. Ms. Kavitha feels Mr. Rama Rao was either responsible for her suspension or chose not to defend her when she was targeted by her cousins. Her remark, therefore, is seen as a calculated attempt to underscore the party’s decline in her absence.

Ms. Kavitha’s reaction reflects a sense of ‘revenge satisfaction’ rather than mere political commentary. Her post suggests that she considers the bypoll outcome a vindication of her belief that she played a significant role within the party and that her exclusion contributed to its setbacks.

The poll outcome added to the turmoil within the BRS, which has been grappling with internal dissension since its loss in the 2023 Assembly elections. Ms Kavitha, daughter of Mr. Chandrashekhar Rao, was suspended from the BRS in September after she accused her cousins, senior party leader T. Harish Rao and J. Santosh Kumar, of tarnishing her father’s image over the Kaleshwaram project controversy.

title: Owaisi thanks voters, party workers of Bihar and Jubilee Hills, reaffirms commitment in Seemanchal
content:
All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen president Asaduddin Owaisi on Friday (November 14) thanked party workers from Bihar and Telangana for working hard to secure the victory in the Seemnachal and in the Jubilee Hills byelections respectively.

Mr. Owaisi said that his party emerged victorious in Amour , Baisi, Kochadhaman , Bahadurganj, and in Jokihat, apart from polling significant numbers in several other constituencies.

Addressing the media at his residence in Hyderabad, Mr. Owaisi said that his party respects the people’s verdict in Bihar. He offered his congratulations and good wishes to Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, and said the party would work for the development of the State, as there was work to be done in the fields of creating employment and developing public infrastructure . He reiterated that Seemanchal’s long standing demands for justice and development would remain at the core of his party’s work. “We will not leave Seemanchal,” he said.

Touching upon the Jubilee Hills bypoll, he thanked voters of Jubilee Hills for ensuring the victory of Congress candidate V. Naveen Yadav whom the AIMIM had supported. “I thank the voters of Jubilee Hills who made Naveen Yadav successful,” he said, adding that Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy had thanked him and that he had conveyed his congratulations in return. He described the win as a significant achievement after the 2023 elections.

Commenting on political developments in Bihar, Mr. Owaisi said he had consistently maintained that the Rashtriya Janata Dal could not halt the advance of the Bharatiya Janata Party. Issuing a word of caution to the electors of that State, he said that they were under a misconception surrounding the Muslim-Yadav combination. He urged the community to move beyond being mere participants in electoral politics and instead become active political stakeholders.

He also said the reduction in the Bharat Rashtra Samithi’s vote share had been evident from the beginning,. He hoped that the Telangana CM Revanth Reddy would work towards improving civic amenities in Hyderabad, including improvements to sewage networks and water supply, particularly for those belonging to weaker sections of society.

On a question related to the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation, Mr. Owaisi said it was too soon comment. He added that political parties needed to introspect and shed any belief that Muslims constituted a captive vote bank or political bonded labour.

title: Former JNTU VC P. Dayaratnam no more
content:
Former Vice-Chancellor of JNTU-Hyderabad Pasala Dayaratnam passed away here on November 11 (Tuesday). He was 93.

A professor of Civil Engineering, he was JNTU-H’s VC between 1995-1998. Earlier, he was the head of Civil Engineering Department and Dean, R&D, IIT Kanpur. Some of his textbooks, Structural Engineering, Brick and Reinforced Structures, Prestressed Concrete Structures, among others, remain popular among students, designers and builders.

For his contributions, he was awarded Sir Arthur Cotton Gold Medal, Nickolaidas Gold Medal from Institution of Engineers (India), Distinguished Engineering Alumnus award from University of Colorado, Outstanding Concrete Technology Award 1997 from Indian Concrete Institute.

Rajendra P. Bhattarai, president of Clean Water Strategies in Austin, Texas, wrote on his social media page: “He was one of the best professors I had at IIT Kanpur. He was also the Head of the Department of Civil Engineering when I was there. He was a giant in reinforced and prestressed concrete structures. He was also very kind, generous and soft spoken. I owe him a lot.” Another engineer from Chennai recollected Mr. Dayaratnam as a great author and that his books were widely referred in teaching and practice.

Mr. Dayaratnam’s funeral was held at the Sahebnagar cemetery in Vanasthalipuram on Wednesday.

title: Guruvayur Chembai music fete to begin on November 16
content:
Guruvayur Devaswom Chembai Sangeetholsavam held in connection with the Guruvayur Ekadashi celebrations will begin on Sunday (November 16). The Sree Guruvayurappan Chembai Music Award ceremony will also be held the same day. Guruvayur Ekadashi will be celebrated on December 1, while Gajarajan Kesavan Memorial Day will be observed on November 30. Preparations for the major spiritual and cultural events are progressing, according to the devaswom.

The Chembai Sangeetholsavam is held in memory of Carnatic music legend Chembai Vaidyanatha Bhagavathar and his Ekadashi Nadopasana. The Tamburu used by Chembai will be ceremonially taken from his ancestral home at Kottayi in Palakkad on Saturday. After receptions at various centres, it will reach the East Nada of the Guruvayur Sreekrishna temple at around 5.45 p.m. on Sunday, where it will be accorded a traditional welcome and installed in the Sangeetha mandapam.

The festival will be inaugurated at 6 p.m. at the Melpathur auditorium (Chembai Music Mandapam) by Kathakali maestro Kalamandalam Gopi. Devaswom chairperson V. K. Vijayan will preside.

During the ceremony, the prestigious Sree Guruvayurappan Chembai Award will be presented to musician Palkulangara K. Ambikadevi. A special concert led by the awardee will follow. Sadanam Harikumar will introduce the awardee, and M. V. Narayanan will deliver the Krishna Geethi Day keynote address. More than two thousand music devotees and leading musicians will participate in the event, which will continue till Ekadashi Day.

On November 30, the Dasami day, the festival will include a elephant procession and aanayootu (elephant feast) as part of the Guruvayur Kesavan memorial observance.

title: Malicious APK scams hit three Hyderabad residents
content:
Three Hyderabad residents lost money in separate cyber frauds after downloading or being tricked into installing malicious APK files that allowed fraudsters to gain remote access to their phones and carry out unauthorised bank transactions.

An officer from the cyber crimes wing of Hyderabad said that the first victim, a 39-year-old resident of Asif Nagar, received a WhatsApp link disguised as an SBI Credit Card update. After installing the file named SBI Credit Card.apk, his phone was compromised and transactions amounting to ₹1,42,881 were carried out from his SBI credit card.

In the second incident, a 43-year-old resident of Gudimalkapur in Karwan lost ₹1 lakh after fraudsters remotely installed an APK titled RTOEchallan.apk on his phone. The amount was transferred through IMPS even though he did not share an OTP or click any link.

In the third case, a 45-year-old Secunderabad resident was told by a caller posing as a YES Bank representative that his card required verification. He was instructed to download a file named YES Bank Credit Card.APK and enter his card details. Soon after, fraudulent transactions worth ₹1,48,380 were made from his YES Bank credit card.

The Cybercrime Unit has urged the public not to download APK files received through WhatsApp, SMS or social media links, warning that such files often mimic government services, banking platforms or RTO challan updates. Once installed, they allow fraudsters to take control of devices and steal sensitive financial information.

title: Bihar done, Bengal next, BJP will uproot jungle raj there: PM's big message
content:
As the NDA registered a resounding victory in the Bihar Assembly elections, Prime Minister Narendra Modi raised the pitch for and set the eyes on Bengal next. Addressing party workers at the BJP headquarters in Delhi on Friday evening, PM Modi said after Bihar, BJP will next uproot the "jungle raj" in Bengal.

As per the Bihar Assembly elections results announced by the Election Commission on Friday, the NDA was crossing the 200-mark, ensuring a 2/3rd majority.

advertisement

"Ganga flows through Bihar and reaches Bengal. Bihar has also paved the way for the BJP's victory in Bengal. I also congratulate the brothers and sisters of Bengal. Now, together with you, the BJP will uproot jungle raj from West Bengal as well," PM Modi said amid a rousing roar from thousands of party workers that were present during the celebrations.

With the Assembly elections to the 293 seats of the West Bengal Legislative Assembly, will be held in 2026, the BJP and the Trinamool are likely to fight around the issues of women's safety, law and order situation, infiltration from Bangladesh, and Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral roll, among others.

The SIR holds special significance in the run-up to the high-stake Bengal polls next year as it aims to flush out illegal voters from the electoral roll, an issue that has become a bone of contention between the two rival parties in the state.

Notably, SIR 1.0 was successfully carried out in Bihar, resulting in the removal of around 65 lakh fake voters from the state's voter list. The Mahagathbandhan vehemently opposed the drive, alleging it deliberately targeted the voter-base favouring them.

PM'S 'PARASITE' ATTACK ON CONGRESS

Continuing his tirade against Opposition party, PM Modi slammed the Congress, calling it a "parasite party", who harms its allies during elections. PM Modi warned that the allies should think twice before tying up with the Congress.

"Even the Congress allies are beginning to understand that the Congress is drowning everyone in its negative politics. That is why, during the Bihar elections, I said that the 'naamdar' of the Congress is practising to drown himself and others in the Bihar elections by taking a dip in the pond," PM Modi asserted.

"I have previously warned Congress allies from this very platform. I said that Congress is a liability. Congress is a parasite that wants to make a comeback by swallowing the vote bank of its allies," he added.

The BJP's perennial star campaigner also said the Congress has turned into what he termed the "Muslim League–Maoist Congress," arguing that the party’s agenda now centres around these influences.

He added that a section within the Congress is uneasy with what he called its negative style of politics and warned that this internal discomfort could eventually lead to another major split in the party.

advertisement

Earlier, the numbers released by the poll panel showed that the NDA – comprising the Nitish Kumar-led JDU, the BJP, Chirag Paswan's Lok Janshakti Party (Ramvilas), and Upendra Kushwaha's RLSP – was on its way to register a landslide victory with over 200 seats.

The Mahagathbandhan of the RJD, Congress and other partners were reduced to less than 30 seats.

This is the NDA's best ever tally in Bihar, with the BJP all set to emerge as the single-largest party in the state for the first time.

- Ends

Published By: Priya Pareek Published On: Nov 14, 2025

title: Bihar Election Result 2025 Live: Ganga flows from Bihar to Bengal and has paved BJP's victory path, says PM
content:
Commenting on the NDA’s sweeping victory in Bihar, Shiv Sena (UBT) MLA Aaditya Thackeray launched a sharp attack on the Election Commission, claiming its “SIR experiment” helped remove around 65 lakh voters to benefit the BJP. He questioned whether Nitish Kumar would truly become chief minister under what he described as the BJP’s political manoeuvring and warned him to remain cautious, saying his party has seen the BJP’s functioning closely.

Thackeray dismissed the idea that women voters were swayed by welfare schemes, arguing that women vote thoughtfully and not on the basis of monetary benefits. He accused the NDA of using the Ladli Behna programme as a cover to justify what he alleged was vote theft. According to him, the outcome was made possible by the Election Commission’s actions, and he criticised the credibility of the poll process, suggesting that with such a large number of voters removed, the institution resembled a “Selection Commission” rather than an election body.

title: Bihar Election Result 2025: NDA 200 paar in Bihar, Mahagathbandhan wiped out
content:
The NDA stormed past the 200-seat mark in the 243-member Bihar Assembly on Friday, scripting a sweeping mandate that effectively wiped out the Mahagathbandhan. What began as an early lead soon turned into a runaway surge, placing the Nitish Kumar-led alliance on the brink of its most dominant performance in the state.

Counting began at 8 am, and postal ballots immediately swung the momentum towards the NDA. Within hours, trends showed the BJP, which had insisted on equal seat-sharing, opening up a significant lead over the JD(U). The saffron party’s strong showing has now triggered speculation over who will play the “big brother” in the alliance going forward.

advertisement

For the opposition, the election proved disastrous. Tejashwi Yadav’s RJD, which emerged as the single-largest party last time, crumbled under the NDA wave, losing more than half its seats. The Congress struggled yet again, reinforcing its status as the Mahagathbandhan’s weakest link. Prashant Kishor’s Jan Suraaj Party, touted in some quarters as a possible disruptor, ended up “farsh par”, failing to make any electoral dent.

Catch Bihar Assembly election results Live Updates here

Exit polls had indicated an NDA edge, but the extent of the sweep, with both BJP and JD(U) clocking massive gains, exceeded most projections. With the BJP clearly outperforming its ally, attention has shifted to the next big question: Will Nitish Kumar take oath as chief minister for a record tenth time, or will an assertive BJP push to claim the top post?

Here's the latest on the Bihar Assembly elections results: The NDA has strengthened its lead in Bihar, with BJP winning 80 seats and JD(U) 67, giving the alliance 147 victories. RJD trails at 20 seats, LJP(RV) has 16, and Congress 6. Smaller parties, including AIMIM, HAMS, and others, have a handful of wins. With 205 seats decided, the NDA is set for a decisive mandate.

Despite high hopes, Prashant Kishor’s party failed to win any seats in Bihar, with most candidates likely to forfeit deposits. Kishor had predicted JD(U) would win “not more than 25 seats,” but the party is set to cross 80, its best performance since 2010. Once a celebrated strategist behind multiple initiatives, Bihar polls mark a major setback for his leadership ambitions.

BJP emerged as the NDA’s “big brother,” while Nitish Kumar’s JD(U) followed. Strong support from Modi and Union ministers boosted the alliance. Junior partners, Chirag Paswan’s LJP(RV), Jitan Ram Manjhi’s HAM, and Upendra Kushwaha’s RLM, showed strong leads. advertisement

In the Mahagathbandhan camp, RJD, the only party in double digits, has 20 wins. Congress wins 6 seats in Bihar election. Left parties like CPI(M) and CPI(ML)(L) are ahead by 1–2 seats each, while the Indian Inclusive Party (IIP) and Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) each have 1 lead.

Lalu Yadav's prodigal son Tej Pratap, who floated his own party (Jan Shakti Janata Dal), concedes defeat in Mahua, praising Bihar voters for choosing a government committed to good governance. In a twist, his estranged brother Tejashwi Yadav maintains a solid lead in Raghopur.

advertisement If the trends hold, Nitish Kumar, written off by many before the campaign began, could return as chief minister for a record fifth term. But with the BJP once again outperforming the JD(U), pushback is inevitable. Meanwhile, BJP and JD(U) workers play drums, burst firecrackers, and chant slogans. JD(U) supporters hold posters reading “Tiger Abhi Zinda Hai.”

The NDA's commanding show indicates a 'Nimo' wave (Nitish Kumar + Narendra Modi). The JD(U) chief’s social-welfare plank, backed by a record turnout of women voters, buoyed the party across key constituencies. PM Modi, a perennial vote magnet, front-loaded an aggressive campaign blitz in the run-up to the polls, sharpening attacks on the RJD with the “jungle raaj” refrain.

Prime Minister Modi celebrated the NDA’s historic Bihar win, calling it a “resounding mandate.” Highlighting women and youth, he said the old “MY” (Muslim-Yadav) formula has been replaced by a new, positive MY – Mahila and Youth, whose aspirations and dreams have overturned the old politics of appeasement.

advertisement In a dramatic twist in the Bihar election tally, Raghopur Assembly Result: Tejashwi Yadav has retained his Raghopur seat, securing 1.18 lakh votes in the 32nd and final round of counting. He defeated BJP’s Satish Kumar, who received 1.04 lakh votes, with a winning margin of 14,532 votes in a closely watched and high-stakes contest.

Chirag Paswan’s LJP(RV) has surprised everyone, winning 17 seats and leading in 2 more, taking its tally to 19. Calling himself the PM’s “Hanuman,” Chirag’s strong comeback gives him significant political leverage, potentially even to claim a deputy chief minister’s post.

- Ends

Published By: Devika Bhattacharya Published On: Nov 14, 2025

title: 'MY' wave sweeps Bihar: The new factor behind NDA's landslide
content:
The 'MY' (Muslim-Yadav) equation powered the rise of Lalu Prasad Yadav's RJD and shaped Bihar's politics for nearly three decades. Cut down to 2025, a new equation seems to have emerged - MY (mahila and youth and EBC) - that has resulted in the NDA securing a decisive mandate in the Bihar elections. A new arithmetic, defined by social welfare, gender, and aspirations, seems to have clicked for the NDA in Bihar, where elections have been largely seen through the caste lens.

advertisement

The NDA's Bihar campaign rested on three factors: the women's vote and Nitish's appeal among them, caste arithmetic boosted by the return of Chirag Paswan and Upendra Kushwaha, and the youth, who were reminded repeatedly by the NDA of the 'katta, dunali, rangdari' (lawlessness) that prevailed during previous RJD regimes.

The Mahagathbandhan, on the other hand, failed to broaden its caste bouquet beyond Muslims and Yadavs, and its campaign centred around "vote chori" failed to strike a chord with the voters. In fact, analysis shows that the NDA also weaned away a chunk of 'MY' voters.

THE CASTE ARITHMETIC

The elections have firmly established that the Bihar of 1995, when the Muslim-Yadav equation ruled the roost, is not the Bihar of 2025.

The NDA, this time, had a wider caste umbrella. The BJP had its upper caste base, while Nitish consolidated EBC support, which has emerged as the X factor in recent elections. The Rashtriya Lok Morcha's Kushwahas, the LJP's Paswans and Hindustani Awam Morcha (S)'s Dalit backing all seem to have aligned perfectly for the NDA.

The EBCs seem to have played a key role behind the NDA's surge from the 2020 polls, where it managed to form the government by a slim margin. The caste survey data released by the Nitish government revealed that EBCs constitute 36% of the population.

The NDA and Nitish, who is from the Kurmi community (around 3% of the population), seem to have consolidated this base through welfare measures targeting EBCs.

It marks a stunning turnaround for the JD(U), which lost over three dozen seats that had a substantial EBC and SC population in the 2020 elections. The JD(U) won only 43 out of the 115 seats it contested. This time, its tally is well over 70.

Strategic caste calculations were also key. For example, in regions like Magadh and Shahabad, the NDA sent Bhojpuri actor Pawan Singh to campaign and along with Upendra Kushwaha's influence, it united the Rajput and Kushwaha vote banks.

WOMEN VOTERS

Over the past five years, women have emerged as a new vote bank in Bihar that appears to be voting on more than just identity and caste issues.

Since 2010, women's turnout has consistently risen. In 2025, the turnout among women voters was 10% higher than men, and the results have shown that they continue to be Nitish's biggest cheerleaders.

advertisement

In fact, since Nitish took charge of the state in 2005, he has cultivated women as a separate vote bank - from introducing a slew of policies, free bicycles for school girls to bringing a liquor prohibition law.

This time, it was the "dashazari" scheme or the Mahila Rojgar Yojana, under which women entrepreneurs are eligible to receive Rs 10,000, that made them vote en masse for the NDA. Complementing this was the 'Lakhpati Didi' programme to foster women's entrepreneurship.

It has shown that the 'M' in Bihar's political narrative is no longer about Muslims or religion, but about mahila power.

During the campaign, several NDA leaders framed the contest as one between "dashazari chunaav" and "katta sarkar" (Contest between Rs 10,000 sop for women and a lawless government, referring to the RJD).

THE NITISH FACTOR

The third factor that fuelled the NDA's surge is Nitish Kumar himself, whose 'Sushashan Babu' and corruption-free image became the bloc's biggest asset.

At 74, Nitish remains relevant more than ever in Bihar's political landscape, shouldering the weight of the NDA's campaign. According to a report, the JD(U) supremo attended 84 rallies, just one fewer than 39-year-old Tejashwi.

advertisement

Thus, Tejashwi's ploy of attacking his erstwhile boss over his health and calling his government "khatara" (rickety) did not strike a chord with the voters who saw Nitish criss-cross the state.

Moreover, the free electricity given to all domestic consumers till 125 units and enhancing the old-age pension for senior citizens from Rs 400 to Rs 1,100 proved to be a game-changer.

It brought Nitish Kumar back in the reckoning among people as Bihar's 'Sushashan Babu'.

- Ends

Published By: Abhishek De Published On: Nov 14, 2025

title: Where is Rahul Gandhi with Congress in the dumps, RJD in a slump?
content:
The Congress has once again delivered a flop show. This time, the defeat came from one of India's most politically crucial states—Bihar—with the Congress' main leader, Rahul Gandhi, nowhere to be seen.

There were rumours that he was last spotted with his niece Miraya Vadra, daughter of Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, at London's Heathrow Airport. But Congress leaders Supriya Shrinate and Ragini Nayak shot down the claims, saying the viral video of Gandhi and his niece dates back to September.

advertisement

So, where exactly is the Leader of the Opposition, the supposed main face of the Congress in Bihar?

As the NDA is heading towards a landslide victory in Bihar, the internet and social media are flooded with memes and questions: Where is Rahul Gandhi?

Rumours suggested that he had jetted off to London or Muscat. But according to fact-check site NewsMeter, there's no official word from the Congress or any credible media confirming Gandhi's flight to London or the Middle East.

For now, nobody has a clue where the General is while his Army crumbles.

As poll results rolled in on Friday, BJP national spokesperson Jaiveer Shergill said, "By the time Rahul Gandhi wakes up in a different time zone abroad, the NDA would have lifted the trophy here." He also implied that Rahul Gandhi was abroad, but did not provide any proof to back his claim.

RAHUL BIHAR BID CRASHED HARD

The fact the Left parties, CPI (ML) (L) and CPI (M), and the AIMIM, are leading in more seats than the Grand Old Party speaks for itself.

To be fair, Rahul Gandhi did mount a massive push in Bihar alongside his Mahagathbandhan ally, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav. His Vote Adhikar Yatra covered 23 districts over 1,300 km in 16 days. The focus was on voter rights and chats with the locals.

It did seemingly rile up the NDA's double-engine in the state, but as it turned out, grassroots connect doesn't happen in a fortnight, especially in a state like Bihar. Here, a tussle came out. While Tejashwi Yadav was talking about jobs and employment, Rahul kept harping on vote theft allegations and the SIR exercise.

Cracking the mindset of India's most backward state, where the average monthly income stands at just Rs 5,700, can't be fixed with the echo-chamber wisdom, no matter how polished, sensible, or realistic it might sound.

Then came the heat of the actual poll campaign, when heavyweights like Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Union Home Minister Amit Shah, and Bihar CM Nitish Kumar were doing back-to-back rallies. Rahul Gandhi suddenly vanished from the scene then.

His Vote Adhikar Yatra wrapped on September 1, after which Gandhi went on a five-nation tour in South America. Then came his H-Bomb, or Hydrogen Bomb: a big presser on "vote theft", but it never detonated.

advertisement

When Gandhi could have used the faint buzz from his Colombia visit and his "vote chori" press conference, he suddenly disappeared from the scene.

He somewhat proved what critics like Jan Suraaj's Prashant Koshor have long said: "These (Delhi leaders) are seasonal birds who only flap in Bihar during polls."

It must be noted that Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj appears to have eaten into the Mahagathbandhan's votes. The Election Commission of India shows 13% votes under "others", which includes Kishor's party that contested all 243 seats for the first time, even as Jan Suraaj does not find a separate mention on the poll website.

Rahul Gandhi is a big leader, but seemingly not so much in Bihar. His absence and his complete silence following Mahagathbandhan's loss suggests as much.

- Ends

Published By: Anand Singh Published On: Nov 14, 2025

title: NDA'S MY formula in, Opposition's communal MY formula out: PM on Bihar landslide
content:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday evening celebrated the National Democratic Alliance’s (NDA) historic triumph in the 2025 Bihar Assembly elections, praising the people of Bihar for giving a “resounding mandate.”

Focusing on the role of women and youth in shaping the outcome, PM Modi said, “Some parties in Bihar had created the appeasement formula of MY. But today’s victory has given a new positive MY formula, and that is Mahila and Youth. Today, Bihar is among those states of the country which have the highest number of youth, and this includes youth from every religion and every caste. Their desire, their aspiration and their dreams have completely destroyed the old communal MY formula of the Jungle Raj people.”

advertisement

He also expressed gratitude to voters in Nagrota in Jammu and Kashmir and Nuapada in Odisha, saying, “They have ensured the BJP’s victory in the by-elections. Today is not just a victory for the NDA, it is also a victory for democracy. It is a victory for those who believe in Indian democracy. This election has further strengthened the public’s trust in the Election Commission of India.”

CHHATH MAIYA AND BIHAR’S PRIDE

Starting his speech, PM Modi said, “Jai Chhathi Maiya, this is a massive victory, an unbreakable trust, the people of Bihar have completely blown everyone away.”

He added, “We are the servants of the people. We keep making the people happy with our hard work and we have stolen the hearts of the people. And that is why the entire Bihar has said ‘Phir ek baar NDA Sarkar’.”

Modi reaffirmed his stance on Jungle Raj and Katta Sarkar, saying, “When I used to speak about Jungle Raj and Katta Sarkar in Bihar elections, the RJD party raised no objections. But it hurt the people of Congress. Today, I want to reiterate that Katta Sarkar will never return to Bihar. The people of Bihar have voted for a developed and prosperous Bihar.”

PM MODI ON BIHAR’S MANDATE

PM Modi emphasised Bihar’s culture and traditions, saying, “To date, Congress and RJD have not apologised to Chhathi Maiya. The people of Bihar will never forget this. Bihar's pride and honour, this is our priority.”

He added, “The people of Bihar have played a huge role in India's development. But those who ruled the country for decades always created a false image of Bihar. These people defamed Bihar. They neither respected Bihar's glorious past, nor its traditions and culture, nor its people.”

Modi also spoke about the government’s efforts to preserve Chhath, saying, “Our government is striving to include Chhath in the UNESCO Heritage List. The goal is to connect the entire country and the world with this culture through its significance.”

He recalled the record voter turnout, saying, “During the election campaign, I had urged the people of Bihar for record voting, and the people of Bihar have broken all records. I had urged the people of Bihar to ensure a resounding victory for the NDA, and the people of Bihar have honoured this request of mine.”

'STRONGEST MANDATE SINCE 2010'

advertisement

Modi described the mandate as Bihar’s strongest since 2010, saying, “After 2010, Bihar has delivered its strongest mandate to the NDA. I wholeheartedly thank the people of Bihar for their support on behalf of all the parties within the NDA.”

He also praised the peaceful voting, saying, “This election has further strengthened the public’s trust in the Election Commission of India. The consistently high voter turnout over the past few years, the increased turnout by the deprived and the exploited, is a significant achievement for the Election Commission. This is the same Bihar that was once dominated by Maoist terror. Voting used to end at 3 pm in Naxal-affected areas. But in this election, people in Bihar have voted without fear, with enthusiasm and excitement. You also know what used to happen in Bihar during the times of Jungle Raj. Violence used to occur openly at polling stations. Ballot boxes were looted. Today, the same Bihar is seeing record voter turnout. It is voting peacefully. Everyone’s vote has been recorded. Everyone has cast their vote as per their choice.”

advertisement

He described Bihar as a symbol of democracy, saying, “Bihar is the land that gave India the pride of being the mother of democracy. Today, the same land has crushed the forces that tried to attack democracy. Bihar has once again shown, ‘Lies lose, public trust wins.’ The people have decisively rejected those relying on false promises and criminal elements.”

RECORD VICTORIES ACROSS STATES

Reflecting on NDA’s electoral success nationally, Modi also said, “Last year, the people of the country gave their mandate to the NDA for the third consecutive time. This was the result of the nation's trust and the blessings of the countrymen. And after the Lok Sabha elections, we also won assembly elections in many states with a resounding majority. Haryana, the land that promoted the spirit of Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan, gave us the opportunity to serve for the third consecutive time. We won a resounding victory in Maharashtra, the holy land of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, Babasaheb Ambedkar, and Veer Savarkar. Maharashtra made us victorious for the third consecutive time. We won with a majority in the national capital after 25 years. And today, in Bihar, where such a large population lives in rural areas, we have won with such overwhelming numbers.”

advertisement

PEACEFUL VOTING AND END OF REPOLLING

On Bihar’s smooth election process, Modi said, “Earlier, there was no election in Bihar where repolling did not take place. For instance, before 2005, repolling happened at hundreds of places. In 1995, repolling took place at more than 1500 polling stations. But as the jungle raj ended, the situation started improving, and in both phases of this election, there was no need for repolling anywhere. This time, the voting was peaceful.”

He added, “During 'Jungal Raj' in Bihar, polling booths used to be vandalised openly, ballot boxes used to be stolen... Now, the same Bihar is witnessing record voting.”

MANDATE FOR DEVELOPMENT AND REJECTION OF NEPOTISM

PM Modi called the results a clear endorsement of development politics, saying, “This victory is a mandate for politics of development and rejection of politics of nepotism. This is a victory for the women of Bihar who had to face wrath of RJD's 'jungle raj'. Bihar verdict has rejected politics of appeasement and replaced it with fulfilment for all. Bihar has proved that people defeat falsehoods and do not support those who are out on bail. Bihar voters have given massive support to SIR, it is now duty of all parties to activate their workers to purify voter lists.”

advertisement

END OF BOOTH CAPTURING AND FEAR IN VOTING

Highlighting the transformation in Bihar’s elections, Modi said, “Booth capturing, violence used to be a regular affair during 'jungle raj' in Bihar elections, but now no such case takes place. There was a time when voting was restricted till 3 pm in areas affected by Naxals, but now people voted without fear. I congratulate people for reposing faith in democracy and Election Commission by voting in record numbers.”

OPPOSITION CRITICISM AND DEVELOPMENT AGENDA

PM Modi criticised the Opposition and reinforced Bihar’s focus on development, saying, “How can those who call Chhath Puja as 'drama' respect traditions of Bihar? They (RJD) used to say that Bihar doesn’t need industry, train and airports. This victory is a mandate for ‘Vikasvaad’ against ‘Vanshvaad’. People of Bihar have played a huge role in the development of Bihar.”

He also stressed voter awareness, saying, “The Bihar elections have validated that our voters, especially the youth, take the accuracy of the voters’ list very seriously. The people of Bihar have shown strong support for an updated voters’ list.”

BIHAR VICTORY SENDS MESSAGE TO WEST BENGAL

PM Modi also highlighted the broader impact of Bihar’s mandate on neighbouring states, particularly West Bengal, saying, "Ganga flows through Bihar and reaches Bengal. Bihar has also paved the way for the BJP's victory in Bengal. I also congratulate the brothers and sisters of Bengal. Now, together with you, the BJP will uproot jungle raj from West Bengal as well."

He added, "Today’s win has energized BJP workers in Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Assam, and West Bengal. And yes, as the Ganga flows from Bihar to Bengal, Bihar has also paved the way for the BJP’s victory in Bengal. I assure my brothers and sisters in Bengal that the BJP, together with you, will uproot ‘Jungle Raj’ from West Bengal as well."

PM Modi also launched a sharp critique of the Congress, saying, "Even the Congress allies are beginning to understand that the Congress is drowning everyone in its negative politics. That is why, during the Bihar elections, I said that the 'naamdar' of the Congress is practising to drown himself and others in the Bihar elections by taking a dip in the pond."

He warned, "I have previously warned Congress allies from this very platform. I said that Congress is a liability. Congress is a parasite that wants to make a comeback by swallowing the vote bank of its allies."

Modi further elaborated on the internal situation within Congress, saying, "Today, the Congress has become MMC- Muslim League Maoist Congress and the entire agenda of the Congress now revolves around this, and therefore, within the Congress as well, a separate faction is emerging that is uncomfortable with this negative politics...I fear that there could be another major split in the Congress."

Reiterating Bihar’s democratic legacy and the significance of peaceful voting, he said, "...Bihar is the land that has given India the pride of being the mother of democracy...Bihar has once again shown that lies lose, people's trust wins. Bihar has made it clear that people will not support those who are out on bail."

He also noted the improvement in electoral conduct, "Earlier, there was no election in Bihar where repolling did not take place. For instance, before 2005, repolling happened at hundreds of places. In 1995, repolling took place at more than 1500 polling stations. But as the jungle raj ended, the situation started improving, and in both phases of this election, there was no need for repolling anywhere. This time, the voting was peaceful..."

JP NADDA ON NDA’S LANDSLIDE

Calling the results a “tsunami” in favour of the NDA, JP Nadda said, “These results indicate that whether it is the people of Bihar or the people of the country, everyone has unwavering faith in the Prime Minister. This mandate endorses the politics of development.”

He added, “The grand alliance was doing politics by dividing society; their strategy was to rule Bihar not with Biharis, but with the help of outsiders. The people of Bihar have given them a befitting reply and sent a clear message that the people of Bihar stand with nationalist forces.”

He added, “The grand alliance was doing politics by dividing society; their strategy was to rule Bihar not with Biharis, but with the help of outsiders. The people of Bihar have given them a befitting reply and sent a clear message that the people of Bihar stand with nationalist forces.”

On behalf of the workers, Nadda said, “I extend my heartfelt congratulations and gratitude to the people of Bihar for the resounding mandate they have given. These results indicate that this is a tsunami. This tsunami has made it clear that whether it is the people of Bihar or the people of the country, everyone has unwavering faith in the Prime Minister, and they have put a seal of approval on the politics of development to take the state forward. This election was between development and Jungle Raj, and people have voted for development.”

CELEBRATION AT BJP HEADQUARTERS

Prime Minister Modi arrived at the BJP headquarters in Delhi with BJP National President JP Nadda, waving a traditional gamcha as party workers cheered, chanted, and applauded. The celebrations reflected the scale of the NDA’s anticipated landslide victory.

ELECTION RESULTS SO FAR

The Election Commission has declared results for 147 seats. The NDA has won 125 seats, the Mahagathbandhan 17 seats, and AIMIM five seats. Counting for the remaining seats is still underway.

- Ends

Published By: Priya Pareek Published On: Nov 14, 2025

title: Election wasn't fair from the beginning: Rahul Gandhi after Congress' Bihar drubbing
content:
Hours after Mahagathbandhan suffered a sweeping defeat in the Bihar Assembly election on Friday, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi thanked voters who backed the alliance but alleged that the contest was compromised from the start. In a post on X, Rahul Gandhi said the Opposition would intensify its fight to “protect the Constitution and democracy”.

“I express my heartfelt gratitude to those millions of voters in Bihar who expressed their trust in the Mahagathbandhan. This result in Bihar is truly surprising. We could not achieve victory in an election that was not fair from the very beginning,” he wrote.

advertisement

Calling the Bihar verdict a setback that warrants introspection, Gandhi said the Congress and the INDIA bloc would “deeply review” the results and strengthen their efforts going forward. “This fight is for the protection of the Constitution and democracy. The Congress Party and the INDIA alliance will deeply review this result and make their efforts to save democracy even more effective,” he added.

The NDA, led by the BJP and JDU, is set for a historic win, while the Congress recorded one of its worst performances in the state since 2010. Meanwhile, other Congress leaders issued a series of unusually candid reactions, calling the verdict “unexpected,” “unacceptable,” and reflective of deep organisational failures.

SERIOUSLY DISAPPONTING: THAROOR

Shashi Tharoor, speaking in Thiruvananthapuram, said the numbers were “seriously disappointing” and demanded a thorough review. “There will have to be some very serious introspection — not just sitting and thinking, but studying what went wrong, what the tactical, messaging or organisational mistakes were,” he said. Tharoor noted he had not been invited to campaign in Bihar and therefore could only rely on discussions with colleagues.

#WATCH | Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala: On #BiharElections, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor says, "... it's very clear that the lead is overwhelmingly with the NDA. It's obviously seriously disappointing, and if that turns out to be the final result, then I think there will have to be pic.twitter.com/10rnFhMEs1— ANI (@ANI) November 14, 2025

VOTE CHORI ON GIGANTIC SCALE: JAIRAM RAMESH

Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh took an even sharper line, alleging large-scale manipulation. “Without doubt, the election results in Bihar reflect vote chori on a gigantic scale — masterminded by the PM, the HM, and the Election Commission,” he posted on X. He added that the party would intensify its campaign to “save democracy.”

NOT THE PEOPLE'S MANDATE: PRIYANK KHARGE

Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge termed the outcome “extremely surprising” and “unacceptable.” He said the results did not reflect the assessments made on the ground, adding, “This is not the people’s mandate.” He called for a detailed examination of how such a verdict emerged.

advertisement

A string of Congress leaders also voiced internal criticisms, signalling deeper organisational unease after the rout.

DECISION-MAKING IN A FEW HANDS: MUMTAZ PATEL

Congress leader Mumtaz Patel issued one of the strongest internal critiques, arguing that the party had failed both in organisation and in recognising its own grassroots workers.

“When we know we are fighting a system that has complete control, the Congress party has to be alert,” she said. “Decision-making is concentrated in the hands of a few people Those familiar with the ground are not given a chance. No one asks them, no one acknowledges them.”

She added that while the party speaks about defending democracy nationally, it must also ensure internal accountability. Patel said the party needs to “win people’s hearts and trust again,” adding that Rahul Gandhi is working hard but is undermined by “a few within our party who manipulate power.”

She also suggested that if opposition parties believe the electoral process is compromised, they should collectively consider a stronger response, even hinting at an election boycott.

advertisement

SHAKEEL AHMAD FLAGS TICKET IRREGULARITIES, AIMIM GAINS

Former Bihar minister Shakeel Ahmad, now outside the Congress, pointed to long-standing allegations over ticket distribution. “Immediately after ticket distribution, several senior Congress leaders held a press conference and alleged financial irregularities and other issues,” he said.

He added that AIMIM’s lead on more seats than the Congress was “shocking.” Citing the party’s past performance, he said the rise of Asaduddin Owaisi’s party indicated that the Muslim electorate in Seemanchal “must have felt they were winning strongly and wanted to prevent a third party from winning.”

#WATCH | Delhi: Regarding the shortcomings of the Congress in the Bihar elections, Former Bihar Minister and Congress leader Shakeel Ahmad says, "I am not in the Congress. I have no right to speak. But immediately after the ticket distribution, several senior Congress leaders pic.twitter.com/DcURDQS6t6— ANI (@ANI) November 14, 2025

NDA BAGS 200 SEATS AS INDIA BLOC SUFFERS MAJOR SETBACK

The BJP-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA) secured a commanding three-fourth majority in the 243-member Bihar Assembly on Friday, clinching as many as 200 seats as per the latest figures on the Election Commission website.

The opposition INDIA bloc managed just 35 seats in a sharply one-sided verdict. The RJD won 23 seats and was leading in two, while the Congress finished with six seats.
